Umineko Project (UP): However, ...nobody got on the opposite side of the seesaw, so he couldn't play on it.
Steam (ST): However, ...unless someone got on the opposite side of the seesaw, you wouldn't be able to play on it.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): However, ...if nobody got on the opposite side of the seesaw, you couldn't play on it.
PC Japanese (JP): しかし、…シーソーは反対側にも誰かが跨ってくれなかったら遊べない。
Russian (RU): Однако... Если другую сторону качелей никто не займёт, вы не сможете качаться на них.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Porém, ...ninguém subia do lado oposto da gangorra, e por isso ele não conseguia brincar nela.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 可蹺蹺板這種玩具，…如果另一頭沒有人坐上去的話是玩不起來的。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 可跷跷板这种玩具，…如果另一头没有人坐上去的话是玩不起来的。
Italian (IT): Tuttavia... non può giocarci, se nessuno si mette alla parte opposta dell'altalena.
Turkish (TR): Ancak, ...tahterevallinin karşı tarafına kimse geçmediği için tahterevallide oynayamadı.

Umineko Project (UP): And no matter how much time passed, nobody came to the opposite side of the seesaw.
Steam (ST): What if lots of time passed...and nobody came to the opposite end?
Original Witch Hunt (OG): And no matter how much time passed, nobody would come to the opposite side of the seesaw.
PC Japanese (JP): そして、いつまで経ってもシーソーの反対側に誰も来てくれない。
Russian (RU): И неважно, сколько пройдёт времени, возможно никто так и не придёт и не усядется на другую сторону качелей.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): E não importa quanto tempo passasse, ninguém vinha ao lado oposto da gangorra.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 然而不管等了多久，那另一頭都等不到人來。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 然而不管等了多久，那另一头都等不到人来。
Italian (IT): E non importa quanto tempo passi, nessuno arriva a sedersi dall'altro lato.
Turkish (TR): Ve ne kadar zaman geçerse geçsin, tahterevallinin karşı tarafına kimse gelmiyordu.

Umineko Project (UP): The seesaw is a popular piece of playground equipment, so if you waited, another person would definitely show up.
Steam (ST): Seesaws are popular, so if you wait long enough, a companion will surely show up.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The seesaw is a popular piece of playground equipment so, if you waited, a companion would surely show up.
PC Japanese (JP): シーソーは人気のある遊具なんだから、待っていれば必ず相手は現れる。
Russian (RU): Качели — одна из самых популярных игр на детской площадке, поэтому, если вы будете ждать, то компаньон несомненно появится.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): A gangorra é uma peça popular entre os brinquedos de um parquinho, então se você esperasse, outra pessoa definitivamente apareceria.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 蹺蹺板是受歡迎的玩具，只要等著就必定會有人來一起玩。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 跷跷板是受欢迎的玩具，只要等着就必定会有人来一起玩。
Italian (IT): Le altalene sono giostre gettonate, quindi se attende abbastanza a lungo, un compagno di giochi si presenterà sicuramente...
Turkish (TR): Tahterevalli popüler bir oyun aleti olduğundan, beklerse başka biri mutlaka ortaya çıkacaktı.

Umineko Project (UP): ......Krauss noticed.
Steam (ST): ...But Krauss noticed something.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......Krauss was aware of that.
PC Japanese (JP): ……蔵臼は気付く。
Russian (RU): ......Краусс знал об этом.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Nisto, Krauss percebeu algo.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……藏臼注意到了。
Chinese Simplified (CN): [=CHT]
Italian (IT): Klaus si era reso conto di una cosa.
Turkish (TR): ......Krauss farkına vardı.

Umineko Project (UP): The weather looked like it was getting worse.{n}That's why nobody was coming outside to play.
Steam (ST): The weather's getting worse. So, nobody's coming outside to play.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The weather looked like it was getting worse. So, nobody would come outside to play.
PC Japanese (JP): 天気が崩れようとしているのだ。だからみんなは表に遊びに出ていないのだ。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 天気が崩れようとしているのだ。{n}だからみんなは表に遊びに出ていないのだ。
Russian (RU): Судя по прогнозам, дела обстояли скверно.{n}Таким образом, никто так и не пришел кататься.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): O tempo parecia estar piorando.{n}Era por isso que ninguém estava vindo para fora para brincar.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 天氣要變壞。{n}所以大家才都不來外面玩。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 天气要变坏。{n}所以大家才都不来外面玩。
Italian (IT): Il tempo stava per peggiorare.{n}Pertanto, nessuno sarebbe uscito fuori a giocare.
Turkish (TR): Hava gittikçe kötüleşiyor gibi görünüyordu.{n}Bu yüzden kimse oynamak için dışarı çıkmıyordu.

Umineko Project (UP): But the seesaw is a popular piece of playground equipment, so someone would definitely come.
Steam (ST): But seesaws are popular, so someone will surely come eventually.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): But the seesaw is a popular piece of playground equipment so, surely someone will come.
PC Japanese (JP): でも、シーソーは人気のある遊具なんだから、必ず誰かが来る。
Russian (RU): Но качели — одна из самым популярных игр на детской площадке, поэтому кто‐нибудь обязательно должен подойти.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Mas a gangorra é uma peça popular entre os brinquedos de um parquinho, então alguém definitivamente viria.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 但也正因為蹺蹺板是受歡迎的玩具，因此必定會有人來。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 但也正因为跷跷板是受欢迎的玩具，因此必定会有人来。
Italian (IT): Ma l'altalena a due è una giostra gettonata, quindi qualcuno sarebbe arrivato di certo...
Turkish (TR): Ama tahterevalli popüler bir oyun aleti olduğu için mutlaka birileri gelirdi.

Umineko Project (UP): ...If he vacated his place because the weather seemed to be getting worse, someone would definitely snatch his place away, and he would end up only longingly gazing from a distance, at someone else having fun playing on the seesaw again...
Steam (ST): ...If he vacated his place because of the worsening weather, it would certainly be snatched away, and once again, he'd end up longingly gazing from a distance at someone else having fun on the seesaw...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ...If he vacated his place because the weather seemed to be getting worse, certainly someone would snatch his place away, and he would end up only longingly gazing at someone having fun playing on the seasaw from a distance again...
PC Japanese (JP): …天気が崩れそうだからとここを明け渡せば、必ず誰かがここを奪い、自分はまたも楽しそうに遊ぶ誰かを遠くから指をくわえて眺めているだけになってしまう…。
Russian (RU): ...Если бы он освободил своё место из‐за того, что прогнозы были всё мрачнее и мрачнее, кто‐нибудь обязательно занял бы его место, и всё закончилось бы тем, что ему с тоской осталось бы наблюдать, как неподалёку на качелях качаются другие...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...Se ele vagasse seu lugar porque o tempo parecia estar piorando, alguém definitivamente afanaria seu lugar, e ele acabaria apenas encarando avidamente à distância, observando outra pessoa se divertir na gangorra...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …如果就因為天氣要變壞而讓出這個位子，那麼必定有人會將它奪走，自己也會再一次，只能在遠處含著手指，看著別人愉快地玩耍了…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): …如果就因为天气要变坏而让出这个位子，那么必定有人会将它夺走，自己也会再一次，只能在远处含着手指，看着别人愉快地玩耍了…。
Italian (IT): Se avesse lasciato il suo posto per via del peggioramento del meteo, qualcuno glielo avrebbe rubato senz'altro, e, ancora una volta, sarebbe finito a fissare amareggiato in lontananza qualcuno che si divertiva a giocarci sopra...
Turkish (TR): ...Eğer hava kötüleşiyor diye yerini bırakırsa, kesinlikle birileri onun yerini kapacaktı, ve o da sadece uzaktan, tahterevallide eğlenen bir başkasını imrenerek seyredecekti...

Umineko Project (UP): On one side of the seesaw, he continued to wait patiently, all alone...{n}That was Krauss's current enterprise, and situation.
Steam (ST): On one side of the seesaw, he continued to wait patiently, all alone... That was Krauss's project...and his current situation.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): On one side of the seesaw, he continued to wait patiently, all alone... That was Krauss's project, and his current situation.
PC Japanese (JP): シーソーの片側で、たったひとりじっと待ち続ける…。それが今の蔵臼の事業、そして状況だった。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): シーソーの片側で、たったひとりじっと待ち続ける…。{n}それが今の蔵臼の事業、そして状況だった。
Russian (RU): Сидя с одной стороны качелей, он продолжал терпеливо ожидать в одиночку...{n}Это был проект Краусса в его текущей ситуации.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Em um lado da gangorra, ele continuava a esperar pacientemente, sozinho...{n}Aquele era o empreendimento de Krauss, bem como sua situação atual.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 坐在蹺蹺板的一側，一個人一動不動地乾等著…。{n}這就是藏臼事業的現狀。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 坐在跷跷板的一侧，一个人一动不动地干等着…。{n}这就是藏臼事业的现状。
Italian (IT): Continuava ad aspettare pazientemente da un versante dell'altalena, restandosene in solitudine...{n}Questo era il piano che Klaus aveva al momento, e queste erano le circostanze in cui si trovava.
Turkish (TR): Tahterevallinin bir tarafında, tek başına sabırla beklemeye devam etti...{n}Krauss'un şu anki girişimi ve durumu buydu.

Speaker: Ushiromiya Krauss
Umineko Project (UP): "............If only I'd had a bit more courage, ...and the self‐confidence to believe in my own foresight...I'd never once......have failed."
Steam (ST): ".........If only I'd had a bit more courage...and the self-confidence to believe in my own foresight, ...I would never...have failed."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "............If only I had a bit more courage, ...and the self-confidence to believe in my own foresight... I'd never, ......have failed."
PC Japanese (JP): 「…………私にもう少しの勇気と、…自分の先見性を信じる自信があれば…。いつだって、……失敗はしなかった。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「…………私にもう少しの勇気と、…自分の先見性を信じる自信があれば…。いつだって、……失敗はしなかった」
Russian (RU): "............Если бы только у меня было больше смелости... и уверенности в себе, чтобы довериться собственному предвидению... я бы никогда... не допустил ошибки."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "............Se eu apenas tivesse um pouco mais de coragem, ...e a autoconfiança para acreditar na minha própria visão...eu nunca......teria falhado."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「…………我如果能再多一點點勇氣，…再對自己預見力多一點點自信的話…。無論哪一次，……我就都不會失敗了。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「…………我如果能再多一点点勇气，…再对自己预见力多一点点自信的话…。无论哪一次，……我就都不会失败了。」
Italian (IT): "...Se solo avessi avuto un po' più di coraggio... e la fiducia nel credere alle mie previsioni... non avrei... mai fallito."
Turkish (TR): "............Keşke biraz daha cesur olsaydım, ...ve kendi öngörüme inanacak kadar kendime güvenebilseydim...Asla......başarısız olmazdım."

Speaker: Ushiromiya Natsuhi
Umineko Project (UP): "...Yes, that's true. Your foresight is never wrong. ......You are the only one who inherited Father's gift. You inherited an innate disposition that none of the other siblings did."
Steam (ST): "...Yes, that's true. Your foresight is never wrong. ...You are the only one who inherited Father's resourcefulness. You inherited an innate disposition that none of the other siblings did."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "...Yes, that's true. Your foresight is never wrong. ......You are the only one who inherited Father's quick wits. You inherited an innate disposition that none of the other siblings did."
PC Japanese (JP): 「…えぇそうです。あなたの先見性はいつも間違っていません。……あなただけが、お父様の才覚を受け継いだのです。他の兄弟たちが誰も受け継がなかった天性のものを受け継がれた。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「…えぇそうです。あなたの先見性はいつも間違っていません。……あなただけが、お父様の才覚を受け継いだのです。他の兄弟たちが誰も受け継がなかった天性のものを受け継がれた」
Russian (RU): "...Да, это правда. Твоё предвидение никогда не подводило. ......Ты единственный, кто унаследовал смекалку отца. У тебя врождённый талант, которого нет ни у одной из твоих сестёр и брата."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "...Sim, isso é verdade. Sua visão nunca está errada. ......Você foi o único que herdou a desenvoltura do pai. Você herdou uma disposição inata que nenhum dos outros irmãos herdou."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「…老公你說得對。你的預料從來都沒有出過錯。……只有老公你一個人繼承了爸的才智。繼承了其他几兄妹中的任何人都沒繼承到的天資。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「…老公你说得对。你的预料从来都没有出过错。……只有老公你一个人继承了爸的才智。继承了其他几兄妹中的任何人都没继承到的天资。」
Italian (IT): "...Sì, è vero. Le tue previsioni non si sbagliano mai... Sei il solo ad aver ereditato l'intraprendenza di tuo padre. Ti sono state trasmesse delle doti che nessuno dei tuoi fratelli ha ricevuto."
Turkish (TR): "...Evet, bu doğru. Öngörün asla yanılmaz. ......Babamın yeteneğini miras alan tek kişi sensin. Diğer kardeşlerin hiçbirinde olmayan doğuştan gelen bir eğilimi miras aldın."

Speaker: Ushiromiya Krauss
Umineko Project (UP): "......Yet, I was unable to believe in it! I always closed my own projects like a coward. ......Why can't I trust myself?! Who would trust a man who can't trust himself? Nobody!!"
Steam (ST): "...But I could never believe in it! I always shut my own projects down like a coward. ...Why can't I believe in myself?! Who would believe in a man who can't believe in himself? Nobody believes!!"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "......Even so, I cannot believe that! I always closed my own projects like a coward. ......Why can't I believe in myself?! Who would believe in a man who can't believe in himself? Nobody believes!!"
PC Japanese (JP): 「……なのに、私はそれを信じられず！　いつも臆病に自らの事業を畳んできた。……なぜ自分を信じることができないのか！　自分を信じられない男を誰が信じる？　誰も信じない！！」
Russian (RU): "......Даже так, я не могу в это поверить! Я всегда как трус погружён в собственные проекты. ......Почему я не могу поверить в себя?! Кто может поверить человеку, который сам себе не доверяет? Никто не поверит!"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "......Ainda assim, fui incapaz de acreditar nela! Sempre fechei meus próprios projetos como um covarde. ......Por que não consigo confiar em mim mesmo?! Quem confiaria em um homem que não consegue confiar nele mesmo? Ninguém!!"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「……可是，我卻沒能相信它！因為害怕，我一次又一次關停了自己的事業。……為什麼我就是無法相信自己呢！連自己都不能相信的男人，還有誰會相信？誰都不會！！」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「……可是，我却没能相信它！因为害怕，我一次又一次关停了自己的事业。……为什么我就是无法相信自己呢！连自己都不能相信的男人，还有谁会相信？谁都不会！！」
Italian (IT): "...Eppure, non riesco a credere in esse! Chiudo sempre i miei progetti come un vigliacco... Perché non riesco a credere in me stesso?! Chi mai darebbe fiducia ad un uomo che non riesce ad avere fiducia in se stesso? Nessuno lo farebbe...!!"
Turkish (TR): "......Yine de buna kendimi inandıramadım! Bir korkak gibi kendi projelerimi her zaman iptal ettim. ......Neden kendime güvenemiyorum?! Kendine güvenemeyen bir adama kim güvenir ki? Kimse!!"

Speaker: Ushiromiya Krauss
Umineko Project (UP): "......I'm always sitting myself down in the seats where the losers must sit; ......my father, my mother, ...and my siblings, all of them sneer at me... How long before I am set free of this complex...... How long........."
Steam (ST): "...I'm always sitting on the seat where the losers must sit... ...and my father, my mother, ...my siblings all sneer at me... How long is it going to take for me to be set free of this emotional complex...? Just how long will it take...?"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "......I'm always sitting on the seat where the losers must sit, ......my father, my mother, ...and my siblings, all of them sneer at me... How long is it going to take for me to be set free of this complex...... How long........."
PC Japanese (JP): 「……私は、いつも敗者の座るべき椅子に自ら座り、……親父にも、お袋にも、…兄弟たちにも嘲笑われる…。私はいつになったら、このコンプレックスから解放されるのだ……。いつになったら………。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「……私は、いつも敗者の座るべき椅子に自ら座り、……親父にも、お袋にも、…兄弟たちにも嘲笑われる…。私はいつになったら、このコンプレックスから解放されるのだ……。いつになったら………」
Russian (RU): "......Я всегда оказываюсь на месте, где полагается быть проигравшим... мой отец, моя мать и мои родные брат и сёстры, все они глумятся надо мной... Сколько пройдёт времени, прежде чем я освобожусь от этого комплекса... Как долго..."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "......Estou sempre sentado no assento onde os perdedores devem sentar; ......meu pai, minha mãe......e meus irmãos, todos eles zombam de mim... Quanto tempo até eu ser libertado deste complexo......? Quanto tempo.........?"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「……我總是自己坐上那該由敗者坐的椅子，……被爸，被媽，…還有弟弟妹妹們嘲笑…。我要到什麼時候，才能從這自卑感中解放出來……。要到什麼時候………」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「……我总是自己坐上那该由败者坐的椅子，……被爸，被妈，…还有弟弟妹妹们嘲笑…。我要到什么时候，才能从这自卑感中解放出来……。要到什么时候………」
Italian (IT): "Mi siedo sempre nel posto riservato ai perdenti... Mio padre, mia madre... e anche i miei fratelli, mi hanno sempre deriso... Quanto tempo dovrò impiegare per liberarmi di questo complesso...? Quanto tempo ci vorrà...?"
Turkish (TR): "......Kendimi her zaman kaybedenlerin oturması gereken koltuklara oturtuyorum; ......babam, annem, ...ve kardeşlerim, hepsi beni küçümsüyor... Bu kompleksten kurtulmam ne kadar sürecek...... Ne kadar........."

Umineko Project (UP): ...Only Natsuhi knew.
Steam (ST): ...Natsuhi was the only one who knew.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): …夏妃だけは知っている。
Russian (RU): ...Лишь Нацухи знала.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...Apenas Natsuhi sabia.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …只有夏妃清楚。
Chinese Simplified (CN): [=CHT]
Italian (IT): ...Solo Natsuhi ne era a conoscenza.
Turkish (TR): ...Sadece Natsuhi biliyordu.

Umineko Project (UP): She knew of Krauss's anguish. As the eldest son of the Ushiromiya family, who would have to shoulder a big responsibility, he couldn't open his pained heart to anyone, and would always be compared to his father's great enterprises...
Steam (ST): Only she knew of Krauss's anguish. As the eldest son of the Ushiromiya family, who would soon be forced to bear an immense responsibility, he couldn't open his pained heart to anyone, and was always getting compared to his father's great enterprises...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): She knew of Krauss's anguish. As the eldest son of the Ushiromiya family, who had been forced to shoulder a big responsibility from now on, he couldn't open his pained heart to anyone, and was always compared to his father's great enterprises....
PC Japanese (JP): 右代宮家の長男として、これから大きな責任を背負っていく蔵臼の、辛い胸中を誰にも打ち明けられず、常に父の偉業と比べられる苦悩を知っている…。
Russian (RU): Она знала, как страдает Краусс. Как старший сын семьи Уширомия, который с того времени был вынужден нести на себе большую ответственность, он не мог открыть своё больное сердце кому попало, и не мог сравниться с великими достижениями своего отца...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Ela conhecia a angústia de Krauss. Como o filho mais velho da família Ushiromiya, que teria que carregar uma grande responsabilidade, ele não podia abrir seu coração dolorido a ninguém, e sempre seria comparado aos grandes empreendimentos de seu pai...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 清楚身為右代宮家長子，今後將會背負起重任的藏臼，那份無法把心中的辛酸向任何人傾吐，還總是會被拿來和父親的偉業相比較的苦惱…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 清楚身为右代宫家长子，今后将会背负起重任的藏臼，那份无法把心中的辛酸向任何人倾吐，还总是会被拿来和父亲的伟业相比较的苦恼…。
Italian (IT): Lei conosceva il dolore di Klaus, i cui traguardi, in qualità di primogenito della famiglia Ushiromiya che in futuro si sarebbe fatto carico di grandi responsabilità, venivano costantemente paragonati ai grandi risultati di suo padre, senza poter rivelare a nessuno quanto soffrisse per ciò...
Turkish (TR): Krauss'un ızdırabını biliyordu. Ushiromiya ailesinin en büyük oğlu olarak büyük bir sorumluluğu omuzlamak zorunda kalacak, acılı kalbini kimseye açamayacak ve her zaman babasının büyük girişimleriyle kıyaslanacaktı...

Speaker: Ushiromiya Natsuhi
Umineko Project (UP): ".........I have finished all the preparations, so you can devote yourself to the family conference. ...All of them."
Steam (ST): "...I've made preparations concerning all other matters, so that you will be able to devote your attention entirely to the family conference. ...Yes, everything else has been seen to."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ".........I'll finish all the preparations, so you can devote yourself to the family conference. ...I'll handle all of them."
PC Japanese (JP): 「………あなたが親族会議に専念できるよう、全ての手配を済ませています。…全て。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「………あなたが親族会議に専念できるよう、全ての手配を済ませています。…全て」
Russian (RU): ".........Я закончу все приготовления, чтобы ты мог полностью сосредоточиться на семейном собрании. ...Я обо всем позабочусь."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ".........Eu terminei todas os preparativos, agora você pode se devotar à conferência familiar. ...Todos eles."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「………為了能讓老公你把一切精力放在親族會議上，我已經把一切都安排好了。…一切。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「………为了能让老公你把一切精力放在亲族会议上，我已经把一切都安排好了。…一切。」

Turkish (TR): ".........Artık kendini aile konferansına verebilirsin, tüm hazırlıkları bitirdim. ...Hepsini."

Speaker: Ushiromiya Krauss
Umineko Project (UP): "............Sorry. ......Will there be any problems......with Father?"
Steam (ST): "......Thank you. ...Will there be... ...any problems dealing with Father?"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "............Sorry. ......Will there be any problems, ......with Father?"
PC Japanese (JP): 「…………すまん。……親父殿の件は、……問題ないかね。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「…………すまん。……親父殿の件は、……問題ないかね」
Russian (RU): "............Извини. ......Могут ли возникнуть какие‐нибудь проблемы... с отцом?"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "............Desculpe. ......Haverá algum problema......com o pai?"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「…………抱歉。……父親的事，……沒問題吧。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「…………抱歉。……父亲的事，……没问题吧。」
Italian (IT): "...Grazie per il disturbo... C'è qualche problema... per quanto riguarda nostro padre?"
Turkish (TR): "............Üzgünüm. ......Babamla herhangi bir sorun......yaşayacak mıyız?"

Speaker: Ushiromiya Natsuhi
Umineko Project (UP): "No. ......Genji and Doctor Nanjo are on our side. ...I'll never allow those greedy siblings to meet Father."
Steam (ST): "No. ...Genji and Doctor Nanjo are on our side. ...I'll never allow those greedy siblings to make contact with Father."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 「はい。……源次と南條先生は私たちの味方です。…あの強欲な兄弟たちを、決してお父様には会わせません。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「はい。……源次と南條先生は私たちの味方です。…あの強欲な兄弟たちを、決してお父様には会わせません」
Russian (RU): "Нет. ......Генджи и доктор Нанджо на нашей стороне. ...Я никогда не допущу, чтобы твои жадные сёстры и брат встретились с отцом."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Não. ......O Genji e o doutor Nanjo estão do nosso lado. ...Nunca permitirei que aqueles irmãos gananciosos vejam o pai."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「沒問題。……源次和南條大夫都是我們這邊的人。…我是決不會讓那幫貪婪的兄妹們和爸見面的。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「没问题。……源次和南条大夫都是我们这边的人。…我是决不会让那帮贪婪的兄妹们和爸见面的。」
Italian (IT): "No... Genji e il dottor Nanjo sono nostri alleati... Nostro padre non entrerà mai a contatto con i tuoi avidi fratelli."
Turkish (TR): "Hayır. ......Genji ve Doktor Nanjo bizim tarafımızda. ...O açgözlü kardeşlerin Babamla görüşmesine asla izin vermeyeceğim."

Speaker: Gohda Toshiro
Umineko Project (UP): "Hello, Gohda here. ......Yes, please leave it to me! I'm anxious to put my skills to work for the big annual job."
Steam (ST): "Hello, Gohda here. ...Yes, please leave it to me! I'm anxious to put my skills to work for the big annual job."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 「もしもし、はい郷田です。……えぇ、お任せ下さい！　年に一度の大仕事に腕が鳴っております。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「もしもし、はい郷田です。……えぇ、お任せ下さい！　年に一度の大仕事に腕が鳴っております」
Russian (RU): "Алло, алло. Да, это Года. ......Да, пожалуйста, предоставьте это мне! Мне очень не терпится приложить свои навыки в выполнении этой большой ежегодной работы."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Alô, sim, Gohda falando. ......Sim, por favor, deixe comigo! Estou ansioso para colocar minhas habilidades a trabalho do grande serviço anual."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「喂喂，是的，鄙人是鄉田。……好的，請包在鄙人身上！為這一年一度的重大任務，鄙人的手都癢了。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「喂喂，是的，鄙人是乡田。……好的，请包在鄙人身上！为这一年一度的重大任务，鄙人的手都痒了。」
Italian (IT): "Pronto? Qui è Gouda... Certo, lasci fare a me! Fremo all'idea di poter sfoggiare le mie abilità in questo prestigioso incarico annuale."
Turkish (TR): "Merhaba, Gohda burada. ......Evet, lütfen bana bırakın! Yıllık büyük iş için yeteneklerimi ortaya koymak için sabırsızlanıyorum."

Umineko Project (UP): Ingredients of varied colors had been gathered in the kitchen, and the preliminary arrangements had already been started.
Steam (ST): In the kitchen, multicolored ingredients were gathered and the preliminary arrangements were promptly being started.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): In the kitchen, multicolored ingredients were gathered and the preliminary arrangements were promptly being started.
PC Japanese (JP): 厨房には、色とりどりの食材が集められ、さっそく下ごしらえが始められていた。
Russian (RU): На кухне были собраны разнообразные ингредиенты, и все необходимые приготовления шли полным ходом.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Ingredientes de cores variadas haviam sido reunidos na cozinha, e os arranjos preliminares já haviam sido iniciados.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 廚房裡聚集了五花八門的食材，已經快馬加鞭地開始第一輪準備了。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 厨房里聚集了五花八门的食材，已经快马加鞭地开始第一轮准备了。
Italian (IT): In cucina erano stati radunati ingredienti di ogni sorta, e i lavori preparatori erano stati prontamente avviati.
Turkish (TR): Mutfakta çeşitli renklerde malzemeler toplanmış ve ön hazırlıklara çoktan başlanmıştı.

Umineko Project (UP): Even though it was still morning, the ingredients for dinner were already in saucepans and steaming.
Steam (ST): Even though it was still morning, the ingredients for dinner were already in saucepans and steaming.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Even though it was still morning, the ingredients for dinner were already in saucepans and steaming.
PC Japanese (JP): まだ午前中だというのに、夕食の食材が鍋に掛けられシュンシュンと湯気を出している。
Russian (RU): Даже несмотря на раннее утро, все ингредиенты уже лежали в кастрюлях и пропаривались.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Mesmo que ainda estivesse de manhã, os ingredientes para o jantar já estavam em caçarolas e fumegando.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 明明還沒到中午，晚餐的食材就已被放進了鍋裡“咻咻”地冒起了熱氣。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 明明还没到中午，晚餐的食材就已被放进了锅里“咻咻”地冒起了热气。
Italian (IT): Nonostante fosse ancora mattina, le vivande per la cena erano già state messe in pentola, dentro a tegami fischianti e fumanti.
Turkish (TR): Daha sabah olmasına rağmen, akşam yemeği için gerekli malzemeler tencerelere konmuş ve buharda pişirilmeye başlanmıştı bile.

Umineko Project (UP): Normally, he had to deal with several assorted matters other than cooking, but on the day of the family conference, he could devote himself to it entirely.
Steam (ST): Normally, he had to deal with several assorted matters, but on the day of the family conference, he could devote himself entirely to cooking.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Normally, he had to deal with several assorted matters other than cooking, but on the day of the family conference, he could devote himself entirely to cooking.
PC Japanese (JP): 普段は料理以外にも雑事をこなさなければならないが、親族会議の日は料理人として専念することができる。
Russian (RU): Обычно Годе приходилось выполнять несколько дел помимо стряпни, но в день семейного собрания он мог полностью посвятить себя кулинарии.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Normalmente, ele tinha que lidar com diversas questões sortidas além de cozinhar, mas no dia da conferência familiar, ele poderia se devotar inteiramente a isso.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 雖然鄉田平時除了烹飪之外還必須做其他雜務，但在親族會議這一天，他可以專心以廚師的身份來工作。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 虽然乡田平时除了烹饪之外还必须做其他杂务，但在亲族会议这一天，他可以专心以厨师的身份来工作。
Italian (IT): Normalmente, oltre al cucinare doveva occuparsi di diverse faccende, ma nel giorno della riunione di famiglia poteva dedicarsi esclusivamente al ruolo di cuoco.
Turkish (TR): Normalde Gohda'nın yemek pişirmek dışında çeşitli işlerle uğraşması gerekirdi ama aile toplantısı günü kendini tamamen bu işe adayabilirdi.

Umineko Project (UP): To Gohda, who was originally a chef, this was surely the greatest gala occasion of the whole year.
Steam (ST): To Gohda, who was originally a chef, this was surely the greatest gala occasion of the whole year.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): To Gohda, who was originally a chef, this was surely the greatest gala occasion of the whole year.
PC Japanese (JP): 元料理人の郷田にとって、一年間で最高の晴れ舞台に違いなかった。
Russian (RU): Для Годы, изначально работавшего шеф‐поваром, это несомненно был самый большой праздник за весь год.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Para Gohda, que originalmente era um chef, esta certamente era a maior ocasião de gala do ano todo.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 對曾經是廚師的鄉田來說，這天毫無疑問是他一年中最棒的華麗舞台。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 对曾经是厨师的乡田来说，这天毫无疑问是他一年中最棒的华丽舞台。
Italian (IT): Per Gouda, che originariamente era uno chef, era senza dubbio il suo più grande momento di tutto l'anno.
Turkish (TR): Aslen bir aşçı olan Gohda için bu kesinlikle tüm yılın en büyük gala etkinliğiydi.

Speaker: Gohda Toshiro
Umineko Project (UP): "Yes, dinner will be an excellent calf steak...! A wonderful cut of meat is already in the refrigerator anxiously waiting for tonight. Please, let the other servants know to look forward to tonight—I will not disappoint them either."
Steam (ST): "Yes, dinner will be calf steak...! A wonderful cut of meat is already anxiously waiting for tonight in the refrigerator. Please, be sure to look forward to dinner."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Yes, dinner will be an excellent calf steak...! A wonderful cut of meat is already anxiously waiting for tonight in the refrigerator. Please, be sure to look forward to the meal tonight."
PC Japanese (JP): 「えぇ、ディナーには仔牛のステーキを…！　素晴らしい肉がすでに保冷庫で今夜を待ちわびておりますよ。賄いも今夜はぜひ期待してください。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「えぇ、ディナーには仔牛のステーキを…！　素晴らしい肉がすでに保冷庫で今夜を待ちわびておりますよ。賄いも今夜はぜひ期待してください」
Russian (RU): "Да, на ужин будет превосходный телячий стейк!.. Превосходная мясная вырезка уже с нетерпением ожидает в морозильной камере. Пожалуйста, с нетерпением ожидайте вечерней трапезы."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Sim, o jantar será um excelente bife à cavala...! Um corte maravilhoso de carne já está na geladeira, ansiosamente esperando por esta noite. Por favor, diga a todos os serviçais esperarem ansiosos pelo jantar desta noite."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「是的是的，晚宴是小牛排…！上等好肉現已在冷藏箱裡焦急地等待著今晚了。今晚的員工餐，也請您務必期待。」

Italian (IT): "Sì, per cena ci sarà una bistecca di vitello...! Uno squisito filetto di carne, che attende con impazienza di venire servito questa sera, è già nel refrigeratore. Si tenga pronto per il catering di stasera."
Turkish (TR): "Evet, akşam yemeğinde mükemmel bir dana bifteği olacak...! Harika bir et parçası buzdolabında bu akşam için sabırsızlıkla bekliyor. Lütfen diğer hizmetkârlara da bu geceyi iple çekmelerini söyleyin—onları da hayal kırıklığına uğratmayacağım."

Umineko Project (UP): It was rare for Gohda to be in this good of a mood towards his fellow servants.
Steam (ST): It was rare for Gohda to be in this good of a mood towards his fellow servants.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 郷田が使用人仲間にこれだけ上機嫌なのは珍しい。
Russian (RU): Это была редкость для Годы, пребывать в таком отличном настроении по отношению к своим коллегам.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Era raro para Gohda se dirigir a conservos com tamanho bom humor.

Chinese Simplified (CN): 乡田会如此高兴地和佣人同事说话是非常少见的。
Italian (IT): Era raro che Gouda fosse così di buon umore verso i suoi colleghi domestici.
Turkish (TR): Gohda'nın hizmetkâr arkadaşlarına karşı bu kadar iyi bir ruh hali içinde olması nadir görülen bir durumdu.

Umineko Project (UP): To Gohda, who boasted about being a chef who worked exclusively for the Ushiromiya family, being given the right to show off his cooking at the family conference was the greatest honor.
Steam (ST): Gohda bragged about being the Ushiromiya family's personal chef, and knowing he was considered worthy to display his excellent cooking at the family conference was his greatest honor.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): To Gohda, who bragged about being a chef attached to the Ushiromiya family, being qualified to announce the cooking at the family conference was his greatest honor.
PC Japanese (JP): 右代宮家専属シェフを自負する郷田にとって、親族会議で自慢の料理を披露する資格を与えられているのは最高の栄誉なのだ。
Russian (RU): Для Годы, который хвастался тем, что является шеф‐поваром в семье Уширомия, быть допущенным к приготовлению еды на семейное собрание являлось наивысшей честью.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Para Gohda, que se gabava sobre ser um chef de cozinha que trabalhava exclusivamente para a família Ushiromiya, ter a oportunidade de exibir sua culinária na conferência familiar era a maior honraria.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 對以身為右代宮家專屬主廚而自負的鄉田來說，獲有在親族會議上展現他自豪料理的資格是他最高的榮譽。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 对以身为右代宫家专属主厨而自负的乡田来说，获有在亲族会议上展现他自豪料理的资格是他最高的荣誉。
Italian (IT): Agli occhi di Gouda, che era orgoglioso di essere lo chef personale della famiglia Ushiromiya, detenere i requisiti per presentare i piatti di cui andava fiero durante la riunione di famiglia era un grandissimo onore.
Turkish (TR): Sadece Ushiromiya ailesi için çalışan bir şef olmakla övünen Gohda için, aile konferansında yemeklerini sergileme hakkı elde etmek en büyük onurdu.

Speaker: Ronoue Genji
Umineko Project (UP): "......OK. I'm leaving it in your hands. ...Also, is Kumasawa there?"
Steam (ST): "...Understood. I will leave everything to you. ...Also, is Kumasawa there?"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "......Understood. I will leave everything to you. ...Also, is Kumasawa there?"
PC Japanese (JP): 「……わかりました。お任せいたしますのでよろしくお願いいたします。…あと、熊沢がそちらにはおりませんか？」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「……わかった。任せるのでよろしく頼む。…あと、熊沢がそちらにいないか？」
Russian (RU): "......Хорошо. Оставляю это на вас. ...И ещё, Кумасава здесь?"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "......Certo. Estou deixando isso em suas mãos. ...E também, a Kumasawa está aí?"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「……知道了。那就托付給你了，請多費心。…還有，熊澤是否在你那邊？」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「……知道了。那就托付给你了，请多费心。…还有，熊泽是否在你那边？」
Italian (IT): "...Ho capito. Ti affido questo incarico importante... Un'altra cosa, Kumasawa si trova lì?"
Turkish (TR): "......Tamam. Bu işi sana bırakıyorum. ...Ayrıca, Kumasawa orada mı?"

Speaker: Gohda Toshiro
Umineko Project (UP): "Kumasawa‐san? I happened to see her earlier, but she is not here. I wonder if she went to make preparations at the guesthouse."
Steam (ST): "Kumasawa-san? I happened to see her earlier, but she is not here. Perhaps she went to get things ready in the guesthouse."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Kumasawa-san? I happened to see her earlier, but she is not here. I wonder if she went to make preparations at the guesthouse."
PC Japanese (JP): 「熊沢さんですか？　先ほど見掛けましたがこちらにはおりません。ゲストハウスの方へ準備に行かれたのではないでしょうか。」

Russian (RU): "Кумасава‐сан? Мне случалось видеть её раньше, но она не здесь. Я думаю, может, она пошла прибираться в домике для гостей."

Turkish (TR): "Kumasawa-san mı? Onu daha önce görmüştüm ama burada değil. Belki de konukevine hazırlık yapmaya gitmiştir."

Speaker: Ronoue Genji
Umineko Project (UP): "......So she's loafing around again. ......No, that's fine. Alright then, I'm counting on you."

Chinese Simplified (CN): 「不乖，好好叫战人哥哥！抱歉啊战人君。」
Italian (IT): "Chiamalo cugino Battler, su! Scusa, Battler‐kun."
Turkish (TR): "Hey, Battler onii-chan de! Üzgünüm, Battler-kun."

Speaker: Ushiromiya Battler
Umineko Project (UP): "No, no, I don't care. Call me Battler. And I'll call you Maria, too. Come on, Maria, it's Halloween! Trick or treeee~at!!"
Steam (ST): "No, no, don't sweat it. Please call me Battler. 'Cause I'll be calling you Maria. Look, Maria, it's Halloween! If you don't give me sweets, I'll play a prank!!"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "No, no, don't sweat it. Please call me Battler. Because I'll also call you Maria. Look, Maria, it's Halloween! If you don't give me sweets, I'll play a prank~!!"
PC Japanese (JP): 「いやいや、気にしないっすよ。俺は戦人と呼んでくれ。俺も真里亞って呼ぶからな。ほら、真里亞、ハロウィンだぞ！　お菓子をくれなきゃイタズラしちゃうぞ〜！！」
Russian (RU): "Нет, нет, не стоит беспокоиться. Пожалуйста, зови меня Баттлер. Поэтому я тоже буду звать тебя Мария. Слушай, Мария, это Хэллоуин! Сладость или гадость~!"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Não, não, eu não ligo. Me chame de Battler. E eu chamarei você de Maria. Vamos lá, Maria, é Halloween! Se não me der doces, farei traveeees~suras!!"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「不用不用，我沒在意。就叫我戰人吧。我呢，也叫你真里亞。來來，真里亞，到萬聖夜了哦！不給糖就搗蛋咯～！！」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「不用不用，我没在意。就叫我战人吧。我呢，也叫你真里亚。来来，真里亚，到万圣夜了哦！不给糖就捣蛋咯～！！」
Italian (IT): "No, no, non preoccuparti. Chiamami pure Battler. Perché io ti chiamerò Maria. Dai Maria, è Halloween! Dolcetto o scherzetto~?!"
Turkish (TR): "Hayır hayır, ben umursamam. Bana Battler diyebilirsin. Ben de sana Maria diyeceğim. Hadi Maria, Cadılar Bayramı'ndayız! Şaka mı şeker mi~!!"

Umineko Project (UP): "Trick or treeee~at!! Kyahahaha, *giggle*giggle*!!"
Steam (ST): "If you don't give me sweets, I'll play a prank!! Kyahahaha, *giggle*!!"

Umineko Project (UP): From inside her handbag, Maria picked out a jack‐o'‐lantern sweet identical to the one she had in her hand, and presented it to Battler.
Steam (ST): From inside her purse, Maria picked out a jack o'lantern sweet similar to the one she had in her hand and presented it to Battler.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): From inside her purse, Maria picked out a jack o'lantern sweet similar to the one she had in her hand and presented it to Battler.
PC Japanese (JP): 真里亞は手提げの中から、手に持っていたのと同じジャックオーランタンのお菓子を取り出すと、戦人に差し出す。
Russian (RU): Мария извлекла из своей сумки конфету‐тыкву наподобие той, что держала в руке, и протянула её Баттлеру.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): De dentro de sua bolsa, Maria pegou um doce do {i:jack‐o'‐lantern} idêntico àquele que ela tinha em sua mão, e deu de presente para Battler.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 真里亞從手提包中，掏出了個和手裡的那個一模一樣的南瓜燈棒棒糖，遞給了戰人。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 真里亚从手提包中，掏出了个和手里的那个一模一样的南瓜灯棒棒糖，递给了战人。
Italian (IT): Maria tirò fuori dalla sua borsetta un dolcetto a forma di zucca di Halloween simile a quella che aveva in mano, e la porse a Battler.
Turkish (TR): Maria el çantasının içinden, elindekinin tıpatıp aynısı olan bir jack-o'-lantern şekeri çıkardı ve Battler'a uzattı.

Umineko Project (UP): It seemed that Battler accepting it was enough to confirm their friendship.
Steam (ST): When Battler accepted it, that seemed to be enough to confirm their friendship.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): It seemed that Battler accepting it was enough to confirm their friendship.
PC Japanese (JP): それを戦人が受け取ることで、彼らの友情の確認は充分なようだった。
Russian (RU): Было видно, что Баттлеру было достаточно принять её, чтобы подтвердить их дружбу.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Quando Battler o aceitasse, a amizade entre eles estaria estabelecida.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 似乎戰人接過它的這一動作，便意味著他們之間的友情得到了充分的認證。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 似乎战人接过它的这一动作，便意味着他们之间的友情得到了充分的认证。
Italian (IT): Il fatto che Battler l'avesse accettata sembrava fosse sufficiente a confermare la loro amicizia.
Turkish (TR): Görünüşe göre Battler'ın bunu kabul etmesi arkadaşlıklarını doğrulamak için yeterliydi.

Umineko Project (UP): The adults felt admiration at how children have their own ways of communicating.
Steam (ST): The adults were amazed at how good children can be at getting along with each other.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The adults were amazed at how the children had established communication with each other.
PC Japanese (JP): 大人たちは、子どもには子どものコミュニケーションがあるのだなぁと感服する。
Russian (RU): Взрослые были поражены, как быстро детям удалось подружиться друг с другом.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Os adultos sentiram admiração a como crianças têm seus próprios jeitos de comunicação.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 大人們心悅誠服地感嘆著孩子們也有孩子們獨有的交流方式。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 大人们心悦诚服地感叹着孩子们也有孩子们独有的交流方式。
Italian (IT): I grandi erano stupiti da come i più piccoli sapessero interagire fra loro.
Turkish (TR): Yetişkinler, çocukların nasıl kendi iletişim yöntemlerine sahip olduklarına hayran kaldılar.

Umineko Project (UP): To Maria, who had been complaining that she wanted to have a Halloween festival, it must have felt like Battler was a friend, since he knew about trick or treat.
Steam (ST): Maria had been throwing a tantrum because she wanted a Halloween festival, so Battler, who knew about trick-or-treating, must have felt like an ally.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): To Maria, who had been complaining that she wanted to have a Halloween festival, it must have felt like Battler was a friend, since he knew about trick or treat.
PC Japanese (JP): ハロウィンのお祭りがしたいと駄々をこねていた真里亞にとって、トリックオアトリートを理解してくれた戦人はきっと仲間のように感じられたに違いない。
Russian (RU): У Марии, которая жаловалась, что ей хочется праздновать Хэллоуин, должно быть, появилось ощущение, что Баттлер — друг, так как он разбирался в обычаях праздника.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Para Maria, que esteve reclamando que queria ter um festival de Halloween, ela deve ter sentido como se Battler fosse um amigo, já que ele sabia sobre o {i:trick or treat}.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 而對於一直死纏爛打著想過萬聖夜的真里亞來說，懂得“不給糖就搗蛋”的戰人，無疑是讓她感到了伙伴般的親近感。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 而对于一直死缠烂打着想过万圣夜的真里亚来说，懂得“不给糖就捣蛋”的战人，无疑是让她感到了伙伴般的亲近感。
Italian (IT): Per Maria, che aveva insistito a più non posso sul voler fare una festa di Halloween, vedere che Battler conosceva la frase ‘dolcetto o scherzetto’ doveva senz'altro farlo sembrare un compagno fidato.
Turkish (TR): Cadılar Bayramı festivali yapmak istediğinden yakınan Maria'ya, Battler'ın şaka mı şeker mi oyununu biliyor olması onu bir arkadaşı gibi hissettirmiş olmalı.

Umineko Project (UP): Her defensive posture from before was completely gone.{n}Now, she was all merry, as though they had been friends for decades.
Steam (ST): Her defensive posture from before was completely gone. Now she was all cheery, as though they'd been friends for decades.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Her defensive posture from before was completely gone. Now, she was all merry, as though they been friends for decades.
PC Japanese (JP): 先ほどまでの警戒ぶりが嘘のよう。今はまるで十年来の友人たちのようにはしゃぎあっているのだった。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 先ほどまでの警戒ぶりが嘘のよう。{n}今はまるで十年来の友人たちのようにはしゃぎあっているのだった。
Russian (RU): От её настороженного выражения лица не осталось и следа.{n}Теперь она была в приподнятом настроении, словно они дружили уже не одно десятилетие.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Sua postura defensiva de antes mudou completamente.{n}Agora, ela estava animada, como se eles já fossem amigo há décadas.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 直到剛才的那副小心提防的樣子，簡直就像是在騙人似的。{n}現在的他們，就宛如認識了十年的老友般開心地歡鬧著。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 直到刚才的那副小心提防的样子，简直就像是在骗人似的。{n}现在的他们，就宛如认识了十年的老友般开心地欢闹着。
Italian (IT): Il suo atteggiamento guardingo di poco prima era come svanito.{n}Ora era tutta contenta, come se fossero amici da decenni.
Turkish (TR): Biraz önceki defansif duruşu tümüyle kaybolmuştu.{n}Şimdi, sanki onlarca yıldır arkadaşlarmış gibi neşeliydi.

Speaker: Ushiromiya Battler
Umineko Project (UP): "Yeah, Halloween's a minor event in Japan, isn't it... You often see people parading around in costume on the news over there, but I've never seen it in Japan."
Steam (ST): "That's right, Halloween's a pretty minor event in Japan. You always see people marching in costume parades on the news from overseas, but I've never seen it here."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "That's right, in Japan, Halloween is a minor event. You oftenly see people marching in costume parades on the news from overseas, but I've never seen it in Japan."
PC Japanese (JP): 「そうだなぁ、日本じゃハロウィンってマイナーなイベントだよな。仮装行列で練り歩くなんて、向こうのニュースではよく見るけど、日本じゃ見たことないぜ。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「そうだなぁ、日本じゃハロウィンってマイナーなイベントだよな。仮装行列で練り歩くなんて、向こうのニュースではよく見るけど、日本じゃ見たことないぜ」
Russian (RU): "Вот как, в Японии Хэллоуин мало кто празднует. Ты видела, как люди ходят в парадных костюмах по зарубежным новостям, но я никогда не видел этого в Японии."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Realmente, o Halloween é um evento de pouca importância no Japão, não é...? Você geralmente vê pessoas desfilando com fantasias nas notícias do exterior, mas eu nunca vi algo assim no Japão."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「是啊，在日本萬聖夜就只是個小型節日。雖然化裝大游行什麼的在外國新聞上經常有看到，但在日本卻是從沒見過呢。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「是啊，在日本万圣夜就只是个小型节日。虽然化装大游行什么的在外国新闻上经常有看到，但在日本却是从没见过呢。」
Italian (IT): "Giusto, Halloween viene festeggiato poco in Giappone. Nei notiziari esteri si vedono spesso persone andare in giro in costume, ma in Giappone non le ho mai viste."
Turkish (TR): "Evet, Japonya'da Cadılar Bayramı küçük bir olay... Yurtdışı haberlerinde sık sık kostümle dolaşan insanlar görüyoruz ama ben bunu Japonya'da hiç görmedim."

Umineko Project (UP): "I'm here 'cause I don't {i:want} to be found. ...I bet she only wants to nag at me anyway, all that crap like "is your appearance alright?" and "mind how you speak"."

Russian (RU): "Не {i:хочу}, чтобы меня нашли, поэтому и пришла сюда. ...В любом случае, я уверена, что она собирается опять читать мне нотации, что‐то вроде 'ты привела себя в порядок?' и 'следи за своей речью'."

Umineko Project (UP): "Hoh... Whyever do you say that...?"

Giusto pochi giorni fa, un processo simile è risultato in una sentenza incredibilmente favorevole per il querelante. Anche gli imputati avevano ribattuto con circa le stesse argomentazioni che noi proclamiamo, ma sono state tutte respinte."

Speaker: Ushiromiya Rudolf
Umineko Project (UP): "...So that other trial was a disaster. ......And I was thinking their conditions were more favorable than ours. That's tough. Then, what about the good news?"

Umineko Project (UP): "I managed to get in contact with their executives. I explained our situation to them, explained that we have no intention of tarnishing their brand image, and I managed to get their understanding."

PC Japanese (JP): 「先方の幹部と接触できました。先方に当方の立ち位置を説明し、先方のブランドイメージを侵害する意図がないことを説明し、理解を得ることができました。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「先方の幹部と接触できました。先方に当方の立ち位置を説明し、先方のブランドイメージを侵害する意図がないことを説明し、理解を得ることができました」
Russian (RU): "Мне удалось пообщаться с руководителем наших оппонентов. Я объяснил им, в какой мы оказались ситуации и то, что у нас нет намерений нарушать их торговую марку, и ещё у меня получилось добиться их понимания."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Consegui entrar em contato com os executivos deles. Expliquei nossa situação a eles, falei que não temos intenção de manchar a imagem da marca, e consegui o entendimento deles."

Chinese Simplified (CN): 「与对方高层的接触成功了。我向对方说明了我方的立场，并解释清楚了我方没有侵害对方品牌形象的意图，成功获取了对方的理解。」
Italian (IT): "Sono riuscito ad entrare in contatto con i dirigenti della parte avversaria.{n}Ho spiegato loro la situazione in cui ci troviamo, aggiungendo che non abbiamo intenzione di rovinare l'immagine del loro marchio, e siamo riusciti a trovare un accordo."
Turkish (TR): "Diğer tarafın yöneticileriyle iletişime geçmeyi başardım. Onlara içinde bulunduğumuz durumu anlattım, markalarının imajını zedelemek gibi bir niyetimiz olmadığını söyledim ve anlayışla karşılamalarını sağlamayı başardım."

Umineko Project (UP): "Honestly, I expect the conditions will be extremely severe. I would assume that changing the company name and the brand name will be inevitable. Where we do have margin in the negotiations is the amount of settlement money, the appearance of a public apology in a major newspaper, and the amount of time needed to carry out those things."
Steam (ST): "To be honest, I expect their terms will be extremely severe. We estimate that changing the company name and the brand name will be inevitable. I think we'll be able to earn some leeway by playing with the amount of settlement money, making a public apology in a major newspaper, and carrying all this out within a reasonable amount of time."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Honestly, I expect the conditions will be extremely severe. We assume that changing the company name and the brand name will be inevitable. Where we do have margin in the negotiations is the amount of settlement money, the appearance of a public apology on a major newspaper, and the amount of time needed to carry out those things."

Нам сообщат количество контрибуционных денег, а также мы будем должны дать публичные извинения в одной из ведущих газет. И чтобы всё это уладить, нам дадут определённый срок времени."

Acredito que ganharemos uma margem nas negociações usando da quantia que já temos estabelecida, fazendo um pedido de desculpas público em um jornal de maior circulação e conduzindo tudo dentro de um período de tempo razoável."

Abbiamo margini di negoziazione nella somma da pattuire, nelle scuse pubbliche da rilasciare su un grande quotidiano, e nel tempo che avremo per compiere il tutto."

Uzlaşma bedelinin miktarıyla oynayarak, büyük bir gazetede kamuoyu önünde özür dileyerek ve tüm bunları makul bir süre içinde gerçekleştirerek biraz hareket alanı kazanabileceğimizi düşünüyorum."

Speaker: Ushiromiya Rudolf
Umineko Project (UP): "......You get all that, you reprobates? Well, to sum up. If we can just pay them off, they're gonna let it slide. All we have to do now is turn our focus onto how much."

Russian (RU): "...А‐а‐а, успокойтесь уже, вы, ублюдки. ......Я найду какой‐нибудь способ раздобыть деньги. А вы, парни, просто поддерживайте бизнес, не вызывая слишком много шума. Наши оппоненты сказали, что простят нас, если мы соберем нужную сумму."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "...Aaaah, acalmem‐se, seus desgraçados. ......Eu encontrarei uma forma de levantar o dinheiro. Vocês só precisam manter os negócios sem muito alarde. Estão dizendo que nos perdoarão contanto que entreguemos o dinheiro."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「…啊啊啊啊，你們冷靜點。……籌錢的事我會想辦法的。你們不用慌，給我維持好業務。對方說了只要堆夠錢就不計較。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「…啊啊啊啊，你们冷静点。……筹钱的事我会想办法的。你们不用慌，给我维持好业务。对方说了只要堆够钱就不计较。」
Italian (IT): "...Aaaah, finitela di starnazzare... Troverò un modo per ottenere i soldi.{n}Voi continuate gli affari senza colare a picco. Loro dicono che se avremo abbastanza verdoni ci perdoneranno."
Turkish (TR): "...Aaaah, sakin olun, sizi adiler. ......Ben parayı bulmanın bir yolunu bulacağım. Sizler çok fazla ses çıkarmadan işlerinizi yürütmeye devam edin. Parayı ödediğimiz sürece bizi affedeceklerini söylüyorlar."

Speaker: Ushiromiya Rudolf
Umineko Project (UP): "We already have thick pipelines in Asia. This'll probably have consequences all over the place, but we can still maintain our deals. The point is, this is a problem that can be entirely resolved just by handing over money."
Steam (ST): We've already got thick pipelines in Asia. Things'll probably be shaky, but we'll be able to maintain our current deals. Basically, if we can just bring the money together, we'll be able to solve all our problems."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): We already have thick pipelines in Asia. Things'll probably be shaky, but we'll be able to maintain transactions. In short, the point is that if we gather the money, we'll be able to settle everything."
PC Japanese (JP): すでに俺たちはアジアに太いパイプを持ってる。色々響くだろうが取引は維持できる。要はカネさえ積めりゃ全て解決できる問題なんだ。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「すでに俺たちはアジアに太いパイプを持ってる。色々響くだろうが取引は維持できる。要はカネさえ積めりゃ全て解決できる問題なんだ」
Russian (RU): "У нас уже есть неплохие подвязки в Азии. Возможно, дела будут идти шатко, но мы сможем сохранить свои сделки. Короче говоря, фишка в том, что если мы получим деньги, то сможем всё уладить."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Já temos oleodutos grossos na Ásia. Isto provavelmente terá consequências por todo o lugar, mas ainda podemos manter nossos acordos. Esse é um problema que pode ser inteiramente resolvido só entregando o dinheiro."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「咱們在亞洲的渠道已經很硬了。雖說是會有種種影響吧，但買賣還是可以維持住的。扼要地說，這是個只需把錢堆夠，一切都能解決的問題。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「咱们在亚洲的渠道已经很硬了。虽说是会有种种影响吧，但买卖还是可以维持住的。扼要地说，这是个只需把钱堆够，一切都能解决的问题。」
Italian (IT): "In Asia abbiamo già una fitta rete di contatti. Ci saranno delle ripercussioni, ma riusciremo a mantenere i nostri business. Per farla breve, se raduneremo abbastanza denaro, tutti i nostri problemi saranno risolti."
Turkish (TR): "Asya'da zaten yoğun boru hatlarımız var. Bunun muhtemelen her yerde sonuçları olacak, ancak yine de mevcut anlaşmalarımızı sürdürebiliriz. Mesele şu ki, bu sadece para vererek tamamen çözülebilecek bir sorun."

Speaker: Ushiromiya Rudolf
Umineko Project (UP): "Just watch, I'll settle everything. I won't let you out in the cold. Start feeling like you're in good hands! When this is all over, I'll be rewarding all of you guys with a champagne tower. I promise. So, just shut up and follow me. Alright?!!"
Steam (ST): "Just you watch. I'll fix all of this. I won't leave you out in the cold. Time to start getting your hopes up again. Once this is all behind us, I'll be rewarding all of you guys with a champagne tower. I promise you that. So shut up and follow me. Got it?!!"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Look, I'll settle everything. I won't let you out in the cold. Start feeling like you've gotten on a big boat! When I settle things safely, I'll be rewarding all of you guys with a champagne tower. I promise. So, shut up and come with me. Alright?!!"
PC Japanese (JP): 「見てろ、俺が全て解決する。お前らを路頭に迷わせなんかしねぇぞ。大船に乗った気でいろぃ！　無事に解決したら、お前ら全員をシャンパンタワーでねぎらってやるぜ。約束する。だから黙って俺についてこい。いいなッ！！」
Russian (RU): "Послушайте, я всё улажу. Я не дам вам пропасть. Можете начинать чувствовать себя, как будто вы забрались на большую спасательную лодку! Когда я всё улажу, то непременно вознагражу вас, парни, целой башней шампанского. Я обещаю. Так что заткнитесь и следуйте за мной. Хорошо?!!"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Apenas assistam, eu resolverei tudo. Não deixarei vocês perdidos à beira da estrada. Comecem sentindo que estão em boas mãos! Quando isto tudo acabar, estarei recompensando todos vocês com uma torre de champanhe. Eu prometo. Então, calem a boca e me sigam. Entenderam?!"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「看好了，我會解決一切的。我可不會讓你們去流落街頭。就當坐在大船上放心好了！等圓滿解決後，我就犒勞你們所有人一座香檳塔。我保證。所以你們只用默默地跟著我就行。懂了嗎！！」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「看好了，我会解决一切的。我可不会让你们去流落街头。就当坐在大船上放心好了！等圆满解决后，我就犒劳你们所有人一座香槟塔。我保证。所以你们只用默默地跟着我就行。懂了吗！！」
Italian (IT): "State a guardare, penserò io a tutto. Non vi butterò in mezzo alla strada. Dormite pure sogni tranquilli! Quando le cose si risolveranno per il meglio, premierò tutto lo staff con fiumi di champagne. Ve lo prometto.{n}Perciò seguitemi senza fiatare. Intesi?!!"
Turkish (TR): "Sadece izleyin, her şeyi halledeceğim. Sizin soğukta kalmanıza izin vermeyeceğim. Emin ellerde olduğunuzu hissetmeye başlayın! Tüm bunlar sona erdiğinde, hepinizi bir şampanya kulesiyle ödüllendireceğim. Söz veriyorum. Bu yüzden çenenizi kapayın ve beni izlemeye devam edin. Anlaşıldı mı?!!"

Umineko Project (UP): The airplane suddenly shook. Probably because of turbulence.
Steam (ST): The airplane suddenly shook, probably due to turbulance.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): ガクンと飛行機が大きく揺れる。気流のせいだろう。
Russian (RU): Аэроплан немного тряхнуло. Скорее всего, это было вызвано турбулентностью.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): O avião sacudiu de repente. Provavelmente por causa da turbulência.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 飛機突然劇烈地搖晃了起來。大概是氣流的原因吧。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 飞机突然剧烈地摇晃了起来。大概是气流的原因吧。
Italian (IT): L'aereo ebbe uno scossone improvviso. Probabilmente era stata una turbolenza.
Turkish (TR): Uçak aniden sallandı. Muhtemelen türbülans yüzünden.

Umineko Project (UP): That shaking roused Rudolf from his sleep.{n}He had woken up early that morning, and had ended up drifting off to sleep while resting in his seat.
Steam (ST): Rudolf was jostled awake. He'd woken early that morning and ended up drifting off to sleep while resting in his seat.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Rudolf woke up because of that shaking. Since he had woken up early that morning, he had ended up drifting off to sleep while resting in his seat.
PC Japanese (JP): その衝撃で留弗夫は目を覚ます。朝が早かったせいもあり、座席に座って一息ついたらあっさり眠ってしまったのだ。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): その衝撃で留弗夫は目を覚ます。{n}朝が早かったせいもあり、座席に座って一息ついたらあっさり眠ってしまったのだ。
Russian (RU): Из‐за этой тряски и проснулся Рудольф.{n}Так как он встал рано утром, то все закончилось тем, что он расслабился и заснул на своем сиденье.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Aquele impacto fez com que Rudolf acordasse.{n}Ele havia levantado cedo aquela manhã, e acabou passando o tempo flutuando ao sono enquanto descansava em seu assento.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 留弗夫因這晃動睜開了眼睛。{n}由於早上起得挺早，他坐到座席上剛歇了口氣就馬上睡著了。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 留弗夫因这晃动睁开了眼睛。{n}由于早上起得挺早，他坐到座席上刚歇了口气就马上睡着了。
Italian (IT): Quel sussulto fece svegliare Rudolf.{n}Dal momento che quella mattina si era svegliato presto, era finito con l'appisolarsi mentre si stava riposando sul suo sedile.
Turkish (TR): Bu sarsıntı Rudolf'u uykusundan uyandırdı.{n}Sabah erken kalkmış ve koltuğunda dinlenirken uykuya dalmıştı.

Speaker: Ushiromiya Kyrie
Umineko Project (UP): "...Are you alright? You're still very drowsy, aren't you? You've been so busy with work lately."
Steam (ST): "...You okay? Are you sure you aren't still pretty sleepy? After all, it seems you've been really busy with work lately."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "...Are you alright? You're still very drowsy, aren't you? Lately, it seems you've been very busy at your work."
PC Japanese (JP): 「…大丈夫？　まだだいぶ眠いんじゃないの？　このところだいぶ仕事が忙しかったようだし。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「…大丈夫？　まだだいぶ眠いんじゃないの？　このところだいぶ仕事が忙しかったようだし」
Russian (RU): "...Ты в порядке? Ты все ещё очень сонный, не так ли? Последнее время ты был очень занят на своей работе."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "...Você está bem? Você ainda está muito sonolento, não? Afinal, ultimamente você tem andado muito ocupado com o trabalho."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「…還好嗎？是不是還很困啊？你最近的工作好像很忙哦。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「…还好吗？是不是还很困啊？你最近的工作好像很忙哦。」
Italian (IT): "...Stai bene? Sei ancora molto assonnato, vero? Di recente mi sei sembrato molto occupato con il lavoro."
Turkish (TR): "...İyi misin? Hala çok uykulusun, değil mi? Son zamanlarda işle çok meşguldün."

Speaker: Ushiromiya Rudolf
Umineko Project (UP): "It's a damned good thing I am busy with work. If I suddenly find myself with nothing to do, we'll all be out in the cold starting the next day."
Steam (ST): "Being busy with work is nothing to complain about, right? Once I've got nothing left to do, it won't be long before we're out in the cold."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Being busy at work is great, isn't it? If I start wasting time, we'll all be out in the cold starting tomorrow."
PC Japanese (JP): 「仕事が忙しいなんて大いに結構じゃねぇか。俺が暇になっちまったら俺たちゃ明日から路頭に迷うぜ。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「仕事が忙しいなんて大いに結構じゃねぇか。俺が暇になっちまったら俺たちゃ明日から路頭に迷うぜ」
Russian (RU): "Быть занятым на работе это же хорошо, не так ли? Если я начну впустую тратить время, то мы окажемся на улице на следующий же день."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Estar ocupado com trabalho não é algo na qual se deva reclamar. Se alguma hora eu ficar sem nada para fazer, vamos ir para à beira da estrada no dia seguinte."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「工作忙那不是好極了嘛？我要是變得有閑工夫，那咱們明天可就要流落街頭了。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「工作忙那不是好极了嘛？我要是变得有闲工夫，那咱们明天可就要流落街头了。」
Italian (IT): "È una cosa molto buona che io sia impegnato con il lavoro, no? Se mi ritrovassi a non fare nulla per troppo tempo, finiremmo tutti su un marciapiede a partire da domani."
Turkish (TR): "İşle meşgul olmam gerçekten iyi bir şey. Birden kendimi yapabileceğim hiçbir şey yokken bulursam, ertesi günden itibaren hepimiz soğukta kalacağız."

Speaker: Ushiromiya Kyrie
Umineko Project (UP): "You're right. Battler‐kun's come back now, so I'm afraid we can't just go around begging if things get rough."
Steam (ST): "Good point. Now that even Battler-kun's back, we'd be looking at worse than just the two of us going around begging."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "You're right. Since Battler-kun's come back, it would be a problem if the two of us had to go around begging."
PC Japanese (JP): 「そうね。戦人くんも帰ってきたんだから、二人で物乞いすればいいって問題じゃないわよ。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「そうね。戦人くんも帰ってきたんだから、二人で物乞いすればいいって問題じゃないわよ」
Russian (RU): "Ты прав. Так как Баттлер‐кун вернулся, то это станет проблемой, если нам обоим придётся ходить и просить милостыню."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Você está certo. Agora que o Battler‐kun voltou, vamos parecer ainda pior do que quando saímos só nós dois implorando quando as coisas apertavam."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「也是啊。畢竟戰人君也回來了，已經不是咱倆去討飯就能完事的問題了哦。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「也是啊。毕竟战人君也回来了，已经不是咱俩去讨饭就能完事的问题了哦。」
Italian (IT): "Hai ragione. Ora che è tornato Battler-kun, sarebbe un problema se noi due andassimo in giro a mendicare."
Turkish (TR): "Haklısın. Battler-kun geri döndü, bu yüzden korkarım işler zorlaşırsa etrafta dolaşıp dilencilik yapamayız."

Speaker: Ushiromiya Rudolf
Umineko Project (UP): "......Yeah. We've finally got our whole family back after six years. ...The man of the house is gonna have to give his best so we can all spend some family time together..."
Steam (ST): "...Yeah. Our family's all together again for the first time in six years. ...So, the leader of our family's got to give it his best if we wanna spend some time alone together..."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "......That's right. After six years, the whole family is present. ...So, the family head has to give his best to be able to spend time together without outsiders..."
PC Japanese (JP): 「……そうだな。６年ぶりに家族が揃ったんだからな。…家族水入らずで過ごせるよう、家長が頑張らねぇとな…。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「……そうだな。６年ぶりに家族が揃ったんだからな。…家族水入らずで過ごせるよう、家長が頑張らねぇとな…」
Russian (RU): "......Точно. Спустя шесть лет вся семья наконец‐то в сборе. ...Так что главе семьи придётся приложить все усилия и провести время со своими родственниками..."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "......Sim. Finalmente temos nossa família toda de volta depois de seis anos.{n}...O homem da casa precisa dar seu melhor para que todos possamos passar algum tempo juntos em família..."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「……是啊。相隔六年一家人才聚在一起。…我這一家之主，可得加把勁讓一家人在一起好好過日子才行啊…」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「……是啊。相隔六年一家人才聚在一起。…我这一家之主，可得加把劲让一家人在一起好好过日子才行啊…」
Italian (IT): "...Giusto. La famiglia si è riunita dopo sei anni... L'uomo di casa deve dare il meglio di sé per poter passare del tempo da solo con i suoi cari..."
Turkish (TR): "......Evet. Altı yıl sonra nihayet tüm ailemize tekrar kavuşabildik. ...Evin erkeği elinden gelenin en iyisini yapmalı ki hep birlikte ailece vakit geçirebilelim..."

Umineko Project (UP): When he looked outside the window, he saw that the airplane was already starting to drop in altitude considerably.
Steam (ST): When he looked out the window, he saw that the airplane had already started to drop in altitude considerably.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 窓の外を見ると、飛行機はもうだいぶ高度を下げ始めている。
Russian (RU): Когда он посмотрел в окно, то увидел, что аэроплан уже начал значительно сбавлять высоту.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Quando ele olhou pela janela, viu que o avião já estava começando a perder altitude consideravelmente.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 朝窗外看去，飛機已降下了不少高度。

Umineko Project (UP): The fishing boats, which had only looked like black grains until a short while ago, had become clearly visible.
Steam (ST): The fishing boats, which had only looked like black grains a short while ago, were starting to become clearly recognizable.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The fishing boats, which had only looked like black grains until a short while ago had started to become clearly visible.
PC Japanese (JP): さっきまでは黒い粒にしか見えなかった漁船が、はっきり見えるようになっていた。
Russian (RU): Рыбацкие лодки, совсем недавно напоминавшие чёрные точки, теперь были отчетливо видны.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Os barcos de pesca, os quais pareciam pontos pretos até um curto momento atrás, já podiam ser vistos claramente.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 直到剛才還如小黑點一般的漁船，已經可以清楚看清形狀了。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 直到刚才还如小黑点一般的渔船，已经可以清楚看清形状了。

Turkish (TR): Kısa bir süre öncesine kadar sadece siyah tanecikler gibi görünen balıkçı tekneleri net bir şekilde görünür hale gelmişti.

Speaker: Ushiromiya Rudolf
Umineko Project (UP): ".........If I could prostrate myself before Dad and borrow ten mil in exchange for a punch to the head, I'd take at least a dozen, but... Failing that, he'd better hurry and give up the ghost."
Steam (ST): "......If I could prostrate myself before Father and get 10 million yen every time he slugged me, I'd do it a dozen times... Or maybe he could just go and die already.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ".........If I could borrow ten million at once by prostrating myself before Father, I'd do it a dozen times, but... If I can't, I better hurry and start to hide myself.
PC Japanese (JP): 「………親父に土下座して、ゲンコツ一発で一千万借りられるなら、１ダースくらいもらっときてぇところなんだがな…。さもなきゃ、とっととお隠れになってくれりゃあいいんだが。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「………親父に土下座して、ゲンコツ一発で一千万借りられるなら、１ダースくらいもらっときてぇところなんだがな…。さもなきゃ、とっととお隠れになってくれりゃあいいんだが」
Russian (RU): ".........Если я бы смог одолжить десять миллионов просто пав ниц перед отцом, то я бы сделал это десятки раз, но... Но если я не могу, то лучше поторопиться и спрятаться где‐нибудь подальше."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ".........Se eu pudesse me prostrar diante do pai e pegar emprestado dez milhões em troca de um soco na cara, eu levaria no mínimo uma dúzia, mas... Ou, ele poderia se entregar e morrer logo."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「………跪在爸面前，吃一拳頭就能借到一千萬的話，我倒真想來個一打份的…。要不然，他若是能趕快駕鶴西去也不錯。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「………跪在爸面前，吃一拳头就能借到一千万的话，我倒真想来个一打份的…。要不然，他若是能赶快驾鹤西去也不错。」
Italian (IT): "...Se potessi prostarmi davanti a mio papà e ricevere in prestito dieci milioni di yen per cazzotto, ne incasserei una dozzina, ma... In alternativa, sarebbe bello se morisse al più presto..."
Turkish (TR): ".........Babamın önünde secdeye kapanıp kafama bir yumruk atması karşılığında on milyon borç alabilseydim, bunu onlarca kez yapardım, ama... Bunu yapmazsa, acele edip yerini hayaletine bıraksa iyi olur."

Speaker: Ushiromiya Rudolf
Umineko Project (UP): " .........I've mooched off him so much over the years, and now I'm going for the inheritance. ............I'm going to hell. ...It won't surprise me a bit if he doesn't want to see me......"
Steam (ST): ......I've always depended heavily on his financial support, and now I'm after his inheritance. .........I'm headed straight to hell. ...I can hardly complain if Father doesn't want to meet the man I've become..."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): .........I've always depended severily on his financial support, and now I'm going for the inheritance. ............I'm going to hell. ...I guess Father won't want to meet me like this......"
PC Japanese (JP): ………さんざんスネをかじって、今度は遺産目当てか。…………俺は地獄行きだな。…そりゃあ、こんな俺に親父も会いたくはないだろうよ……。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「………さんざんスネをかじって、今度は遺産目当てか。…………俺は地獄行きだな。…そりゃあ、こんな俺に親父も会いたくはないだろうよ……」

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): " .........Eu já suguei tanto dele ao longo dos anos, e agora estou atrás da herança dele. ............Vou ir para o inferno assim. ...Não vou ficar surpreso se ele não quiser me ver depois de tudo isso......"

Chinese Simplified (CN): 「………要了老爷子那么多钱，这次又盘算着他的遗产么？…………我是下定地狱了。…哎，这样的我，爸怎么会想见……」

Turkish (TR): ".........Yıllar boyunca ondan çok şey kopardım, ve şimdi de mirasına konacağım. ............Cehennemin dibini boylayacağım. ...Eğer beni görmek istemezse hiç şaşırmam......"

Umineko Project (UP): Nanjo looked at Kinzo's face, sighing.{n}...Kinzo's eyes remained rooted to those strange magic books.
Steam (ST): Nanjo looked at Kinzo's face, sighing. ...Kinzo's eyes remained rooted to a strange book on magic.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Nanjo looked at Kinzo's face, sighing....Kinzo's eyes were rooted to those strange magic books.

PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 南條はため息をつきながら金蔵の顔を見る。{n}…金蔵の目は怪しげな魔法書に釘付けのままだった。

Speaker: Ushiromiya Kinzo
Umineko Project (UP): "I have no intention of joining those vultures in their discussion. They can discuss how they will suck my bones as they wish. ......They are not worth a moment of my time."
Steam (ST): "I have no intention of joining those vultures in their debate. They can discuss how they'll suck my bones dry on their own. ...How utterly contemptible."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "I don't want to join in on the argument of those vultures. They can discuss how they will suck my bones as they wish. ......They really are foolish."
PC Japanese (JP): 「ハゲタカどもの議論に加わるつもりはない。好きに我が骨のしゃぶり方でも議論するがよかろう。……実に下らぬ。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「ハゲタカどもの議論に加わるつもりはない。好きに我が骨のしゃぶり方でも議論するがよかろう。……実に下らぬ」

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Não tenho intenção de me juntar àqueles abutres em sua discussão. Eles podem discutir como sugarão meus ossos como quiserem. ......Não são dignos de um momento do meu tempo."

Chinese Simplified (CN): 「我不打算加入秃鹫们的讨论。我的骨头的啃法，他们想怎么讨论就怎么讨论好了。……实在是不值一提。」

Turkish (TR): "Tartışmalarında o akbabalara katılmaya hiç niyetim yok. Diledikleri gibi kemiklerimi nasıl sömüreceklerini tartışabilirler. ......Bir dakikamı bile harcamaya değmezler."

Umineko Project (UP): ...To him, children and grandchildren were to be adored.{n}And he believed that their growth was the only enjoyment for old men.
Steam (ST): ...To him, children and grandchildren were lovely things. He believed watching them grow was the only way to truly enjoy old age.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ...To him, children and grandchildren were lovely things. And he believed that their growth was the only enjoyment for old men.
PC Japanese (JP): …彼にとって子や孫は可愛いものだ。そして、彼らの成長は老後の唯一の楽しみだと信じている。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): …彼にとって子や孫は可愛いものだ。{n}そして、彼らの成長は老後の唯一の楽しみだと信じている。

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...Para ele, filhos e netos eram para serem adorados.{n}Ele acreditava que assistir eles crescerem era a verdadeira satisfação dos idosos.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …在他看來，兒輩和孫輩都是很討人喜歡的。{n}並且他也深信，他們的成長是自己老後唯一的樂趣。

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Por isso, as palavras de Kinzo eram extremamente tristes para ele.

Turkish (TR): Kinzo'nun sözlerini çok üzücü buldu.

Speaker: Ushiromiya Kinzo
Umineko Project (UP): "If the time comes when I must leave this room, I will show myself then. ......Just as that one does not show itself."
Steam (ST): "If the time comes for me to leave this room, I will show myself. ...Just as she does not show herself yet."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "If the time I must leave this room comes, I will show myself. ......Just as that one does not show itself."
PC Japanese (JP): 「この部屋を出るべき時が来れば私は姿を現す。……あれが姿を今だ現さぬようにな。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「この部屋を出るべき時が来れば私は姿を現す。……あれが姿を未だ現さぬようにな」
Russian (RU): "Если придёт время, когда я должен буду покинуть эту комнату, то я покажу себя. ......Так же как и та, которая не показывается мне."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Se a hora em que devo deixar este quarto chegar, eu então darei as caras. ......Bem como ela ainda não se mostrou."

Umineko Project (UP): Kinzo raised his face, and in the direction of his gaze was the portrait of the witch, respectfully displayed on the wall...
Steam (ST): When Kinzo raised his face, his gaze pointed at the portrait of the witch, which was respectfully displayed on the wall...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): When Kinzo raised his face, in the direction of his gaze was the portrait of the witch, which was respectfully displayed on the wall...

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Havia apenas o rosto da bruxa na pintura a óleo, que nunca sorria fora de seu retrato...

Steam (ST): Everybody knew that interrupting Kinzo when he talked about {f:5:Beatrice} would trigger his wrath...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Everybody knew that when Kinzo talked about Beatrice, unnecessarily cutting in would instigate his wrath...
PC Japanese (JP): 金蔵がベアトリーチェの話をする時、余計な口を挟むことは、彼の逆鱗に触れることも同じであることを、誰もが知っていた…。
Russian (RU): Все знали, что когда Кинзо начинал говорить о {f:5:Беатриче}, то было очень легко спровоцировать его гнев...

Umineko Project (UP): "Today, I will...perform a certain ritual."
Steam (ST): "Today, I will...hold a certain ceremony."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Today, I will...hold a certain ceremony."

Speaker: Ushiromiya Kinzo
Umineko Project (UP): "......It would be more accurate to call it a gamble. ...After all, no miracles dwell in magic without risk."
Steam (ST): "...Perhaps it is closer to a gamble than a ceremony. ...After all, magic without risk can never house a miracle."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "......It would be more accurate to call it a gamble. ...After all, miracles only dwell within magics based on risk."
PC Japanese (JP): 「……儀式というよりは、博打に近い。…なぜなら、リスクを負わぬ魔法に奇跡は宿らぬからだ。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「……儀式というよりは、博打に近い。…なぜなら、リスクを負わぬ魔法に奇跡は宿らぬからだ」
Russian (RU): "......Будет более правильным назвать это азартной игрой. ...Потому что чудеса не совершаются при помощи магии, которая не несет в себе риска."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "......Talvez seja mais adequado chamar de aposta. ...Afinal, nenhum milagre habita em um magia sem risco."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「……比起說是儀式，更接近於賭博。…我之所以這麼說，是因為不背負風險的魔法不會宿上奇跡。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「……比起说是仪式，更接近于赌博。…我之所以这么说，是因为不背负风险的魔法不会宿上奇迹。」
Italian (IT): "...Più che una cerimonia, sarebbe meglio definirla un azzardo...{n}Dopotutto, i miracoli non albergano in magie che non si basano sul rischio."
Turkish (TR): "......Buna bir kumar demek daha doğru olur. ...Ne de olsa, büyüde risk olmadan mucize gerçekleşmez."

Umineko Project (UP): Nanjo had already heard this countless times.{n}You could call it Kinzo's favorite phrase.
Steam (ST): Nanjo had heard Kinzo say this many times before. You might even call it a pet phrase of Kinzo's.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Nanjo already heard that story many times over. You could call it Kinzo's favorite phrase.
PC Japanese (JP): その話を南條はもう何度も聞いている。金蔵の口癖といってもいい。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): その話を南條はもう何度も聞いている。{n}金蔵の口癖といってもいい。
Russian (RU): Нанджо уже много раз слышал эту историю.{n}Это можно было бы назвать любимой поговоркой Кинзо.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Nanjo já havia ouvido aquilo incontáveis vezes.{n}Você poderia considerá‐la como a frase favorita de Kinzo.

Umineko Project (UP): ......It seemed that Kinzo believed in magic and miracles arising through betting his own fate with a certain kind of risky probability and beating the odds...
Steam (ST): ...Kinzo apparently believed that magic and miracles could occur if you gambled your own fate with a certain amount of risk and triumphed...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......It seemed that Kinzo believed that magic and miracles could happen by betting your own fate with certain kind of risk and triumphing...

Speaker: Nanjo Terumasa
Umineko Project (UP): "Kinzo‐san, you may once have been called the Golden Gambler, but I cannot imagine what kind of gamble you will take on with that aged body, when you could go to the other world at any time... I guess this will be worth seeing..."

PC Japanese (JP): 「かつて黄金のギャンブラーと言われた金蔵さんが、いつお迎えが来てもおかしくないそのご老体で、一体どんな博打に挑みますやら…。これは見物ですな…。」

Russian (RU): "Итак, Кинзо‐сан, вы тот, кого однажды называли Золотым Игроком теперь стали старым человеком и можете отправиться на тот свет в любую минуту, мне интересно, какого рода азартную игру вы затеяли... Думаю, зрелище будет достойное..."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Kinzo‐san, você pode uma vez ter sido chamado de Apostador Dourado, mas não consigo imaginar que tipo de aposta você fará com esse corpo envelhecido, quando você poderia ir ao outro mundo a qualquer hora... Acho que isto será digno de ver..."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「曾經被稱為黃金賭徒的金藏先生，究竟要以這不管何時迎來大限都不奇怪的老體，去挑戰一場什麼樣的賭博呢…。這可真是值得一看啊…」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「曾经被称为黄金赌徒的金藏先生，究竟要以这不管何时迎来大限都不奇怪的老体，去挑战一场什么样的赌博呢…。这可真是值得一看啊…」
Italian (IT): "Kinzo-san, un tempo chiamato lo ‘Scommettitore Dorato’, e il cui corpo invecchiato ora potrebbe spirare in qualsiasi momento, ha intenzione di intraprendere un azzardo... Mi chiedo di cosa si tratti... Varrà la pena vederlo..."

Speaker: Ushiromiya Kinzo
Umineko Project (UP): "Hmph... ......I see. So, if it were up to you, unversed in magic, even this secret ritual I have thoroughly researched would be branded as a gamble. So be it."

Russian (RU): "Хмпф... ......Понятно. Если тайный ритуал, который я разработал в ходе своих исследований, будет показан тебе, ничего не смыслящему в магии, то интересно, назовешь ли ты его азартной игрой? Да и какая, в общем‐то, разница..."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Hmph... ......Compreendo. Então se coubesse a você, desconhecedor da magia, até este cerimônia secreta que pesquisei minuciosamente seria rotulada como uma aposta. Então que seja."

Chinese Simplified (CN): 「哼…。……原来如此。我研究得登峰造极了的秘术仪式，摆在你这不擅魔法之人面前，就只是会被叫成赌博么？也罢。」

Speaker: Ushiromiya Kinzo

If you win, ......it will all end as, just as you observed, nothing more than the vagary of an old man who could go to the other world at any time."

If you win, ......it will all end as nothing more than the vagary of the old man who can go to the other world at any time, in accordance to what you saw."
PC Japanese (JP): 「……………奇跡を信じる私が勝てば、お前の目には酔狂にしか見えなかったであろう我が研究の全てがこの日に結実したことを、はっきりと理解できるだろう。お前が勝てば、……見たままの通り、いつ迎えが来てもおかしくない年寄りの酔狂に終わるだけだ。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「……………奇跡を信じる私が勝てば、お前の目には酔狂にしか見えなかったであろう我が研究の全てがこの日に結実したことを、はっきりと理解できるだろう。お前が勝てば、……見たままの通り、いつ迎えが来てもおかしくない年寄りの酔狂に終わるだけだ」
Russian (RU): "...............Я верю в чудеса, и если я выиграю, то ты чётко поймешь, что все мои исследования, вероятно кажущиеся тебе простым капризом, принесут свои плоды. Если выиграешь ты... То это все закончится как не более чем каприз старика, который может умереть в любую минуту, в точности так, как это и видится тебе."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "...............Se eu, um crente em milagres, sair vitorioso...você será capaz de entender claramente que toda a minha pesquisa, a qual provavelmente aparece apenas como capricho em seus olhos, gerou fruto neste dia. Se você vencer, ......tudo acabará como, assim como você observou, nada mais que o capricho de um velho homem que poderia ir para o outro mundo a qualquer hora."

Se vincerai tu... tutto si concluderà in accordo con le tue aspettative, ossia, come il mero vagheggiare di un vecchio decrepito che potrebbe spirare in qualsiasi momento."

Eğer siz kazanırsanız, ......her şey sizin de gözlemlediğiniz gibi, her an öteki dünyaya gidebilecek yaşlı bir adamın kaprislerinden başka bir şey olmayacak."

Steam (ST): "What...?"

Speaker: Nanjo Terumasa
Umineko Project (UP): "You know, Battler‐kun from Rudolf‐san's family. I hear he will be coming for the first time in six years. I'm sure he has become a splendid boy."

Umineko Project (UP): Upon hearing Battler's name, he showed an ill‐humored expression, as though he had been let down, and turned his back to Nanjo again.

Speaker: Ushiromiya Kinzo
Umineko Project (UP): "Hmph. ......Perhaps a truly long‐awaited guest.........will pay us a visit. .........Everything depends on the results of the roulette. ...The roulette is already starting to revolve. Rouge, or noir?"
Steam (ST): "Hmph. ...However, we might actually receive a visit... ......from a truly longed-for guest. ...Everything depends on the results of the roulette. ...The roulette has already started to spin. Will it be rouge, or noir?"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Hmph. ......Possibly, a truly longed-for guest, .........will pay us a visit. .........Everything depends on the results of the roulette. ...The roulette is already starting to revolve. Rouge, or Noir?"
PC Japanese (JP): 「ふ。……本当に懐かしい客は、………あるいは訪れるかもしれん。………全てはルーレットの出目次第だ。…すでにルーレットは回り始めている。ルージュか、ノワールか。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「ふ。……本当に懐かしい客は、………あるいは訪れるかもしれん。………全てはルーレットの出目次第だ。…すでにルーレットは回り始めている。赤か、黒か」
Russian (RU): "Хмф. .....Возможно, что действительно долгожданный гость... наградит нас своим визитом. .........Всё зависит от результатов рулетки. ...Рулетка уже начала вращаться. Красное или чёрное?"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Hmph. ......Talvez um hóspede verdadeiramente muito esperado.........nos fará uma visita. .........Tudo depende dos resultados da roleta. ...A roleta já está começando a girar. Será {i:rouge} ou será {i:noir}?"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「哼。……真正久違的客人，………或許真的會到訪。………一切都要看輪盤賭滾出來的結果如何。…輪盤早已開始轉了。會是{ruby:rouge:紅色}，還是{ruby:noir:黑色}呢？」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「哼。……真正久违的客人，………或许真的会到访。………一切都要看轮盘赌滚出来的结果如何。…轮盘早已开始转了。会是{ruby:rouge:红色}，还是{ruby:noir:黑色}呢？」
Italian (IT): "Hmph... In realtà, potremmo davvero ricevere la visita... di un ospite molto atteso... Tutto dipende dal risultato della roulette... La roulette sta già iniziando a girare. Finirà sul rosso, oppure sul nero...?"
Turkish (TR): "Hmph. ......Belki de gerçekten uzun zamandır beklenen bir misafir.........bizi ziyaret eder. .........Her şey ruletin sonuçlarına bağlı. ...Rulet çoktan dönmeye başladı bile. Kırmızı mı, siyah mı?"

Speaker: Ushiromiya Kinzo
Umineko Project (UP): "............Tonight, let us enjoy ourselves as we see what kind of miracle the roulette will show us. ...The payoffs are large. And I don't feel like losing... ......{f:5:Beatrice}, ...you shall accept my bet........."
Steam (ST): "......Tonight, let us enjoy ourselves, as we see what kind of miracle the roulette will show us. ...The payoffs are large. And I don't intend to lose... ...{f:5:Beatrice}, ...accept my bet......"

PC Japanese (JP): 「…………今宵、ルーレットがどんな奇跡を見せてくれるのか、楽しませてもらおうではないか。…配当は大きいぞ。そして負ける気はせぬ…。……ベアトリーチェよ、…我が賭けを受けるがいい………。」

Russian (RU): "............Сегодня давайте насладимся чудесами, которые нам явит рулетка. ...Ставки велики. И я не собираюсь проигрывать... {f:5:Беатриче}... можешь принять мою ставку..."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "............Esta noite, vamos nos divertir enquanto vemos que tipo de milagre a roleta nos mostrará. ...Os pagamentos são grandes. E não sinto que vou perder... ......{f:5:Beatrice}, ...você deve aceitar minha aposta........."

PC Japanese (JP): 南條は、笑っているのか、悲しんでいるのかすらも量れない淡白な表情を浮かべる肖像画の魔女を見やり、鉛色の空を見上げるのだった……。
Russian (RU): Нанджо взглянул на портрет ведьмы, что взирала с непринужденным выражением лица, словно так и не определившись, будет ли она улыбаться или грустить, а затем посмотрел на свинцового цвета небо...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Nanjo olhou de relance para a bruxa do retrato, com sua expressão cândida, a qual ele não conseguia definir como feliz ou triste, e então olhou para o céu plúmbeo......

Italian (IT): Nanjo fissò la strega del ritratto, la cui espressione indifferente non permetteva di comprendere se stesse sorridendo o se fosse triste, e poi volse lo sguardo al cielo plumbeo...
Turkish (TR): Portredeki cadıya ve onun mutlu mu yoksa üzgün mü olduğunu anlayamadığı samimi ifadesine bir göz gezdirdikten sonra Nanjo, bakışlarını kapalı gökyüzüne yöneltti......
